poem:
Elegy for an Actor

Caught in the chaos,
John Ashton,
not the hero, but the heart—
flummoxed and buffoonish,
in the laughter of the eighties,
fates intertwined with folly.
Cancer, the final director,  
calls cut—  
a soul exits stage left  
leaving us  
in a world less staged,  
but no less chaotic.
